description: If (p_k)^(c_k) is highest power of p_k dividing n (where p_k is a prime dividing n and p_k > p_j for all k > j), then (p_k)^(c_k) < (p_j)^(c_j) for all k > j.
links: Lei Zhou, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Select[Range[575], Greater @@ Power @@@ (fi = FactorInteger[#]) && Length[fi] > 1 &] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 06 2008 *)
author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 24 2000
